pullRequest.body:
From PFR


---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->
- [x] depends on: #18663

Do people think this should go in a new file?

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

### PR summary [5139ec5aef](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/17915/commits/5139ec5aefa4adff6ac1cb51e238a34ac0ae4c31)

<details><summary>

#### Import changes for modified files

</summary>

Dependency changes

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.Probability.Independence.Kernel | 1360 | 1361 | +1 (+0.07%) |
| Mathlib.Probability.Independence.Basic | 1361 | 1362 | +1 (+0.07%) |


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Probability.Independence.Basic` `Mathlib.Probability.Independence.Kernel`|1|

</details>

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ cond_iInter`
`+ iIndepFun.cond`
`+ iIndepFun.cond_iInter`
`+ prod_inv_distrib`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
</details>

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#18663~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ü§ñ). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

Thanks!

maintainer merge
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by kex-y.

This PR significantly increases imports to many files. I would strongly prefer that material is moved to new files instead.

And if there's a good reason that can't / shouldn't happen, then it needs to be discussed, at least in the PR description, ideally even in module doc-strings, before we should merge.
I was hoping a probability theorist (@RemyDegenne ? @kex-y ?) would come and tell where they would like those lemmas to live.
I suppose you can put these lemmas in Probability/Independence/Conditional

Turns out moving things to `Probability.Independence.Basic` works just fine. I've taken the opportunity to add the kernel version of the first lemma (the second lemma I don't think one can state yet), but I can't deduce the one measure version from it because the sigma-algebra fed into `iIndepFun` is of a specific shape.

:v: YaelDillies can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11986599771/job/33419820043)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11986599771/job/33419819968)

LGTM
bors d+

LGTM
bors d+

Can you use the `Œº[| X ‚Üê x]` notation on the RHS
```suggestion
    Œº[|‚ãÇ i, Y i ‚Åª¬π' t i] (‚ãÇ i ‚àà s, f i) = ‚àè i ‚àà s, Œº[|Y i ‚Üê t i] (f i) := by
```

```suggestion
    Œº[‚ãÇ i ‚àà s, f i | ‚ãÇ i, Y i ‚Åª¬π' t i] = ‚àè i ‚àà s, Œº[f i | Y i in t i] := by
```
Does this work?
Whoops sorry I had already done this change locally, but somehow reverted it before pushing
If `Œº (Y i ‚Åª¬π' t i) = 0` for some `i` then the conditional measure is the zero measure and the statement should still hold true right?
Same comment for the previous lemma
The zero measure is not independent (at least not according to mathlib's definition) because `0 (‚ãÇ i ‚àà ‚àÖ, f i) ‚â† ‚àè i ‚àà ‚àÖ, 0 (f i)` (see `iIndepFun_iff`)
That comment refers to a completely undefined lemma (unless you happen to know that a similarly name lemma exists in another file). Please make the reference more precise or remove it.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: independence of functions under conditioning
